Payroll and Benefits Specialist:
THE ORGANIZATION 

The Flowr Corporation is a Toronto-headquartered cannabis company with operations in Canada, Europe, and Australia. Our Canadian operating campus, located in Kelowna, BC, includes a purpose-built, GMP-designed indoor cultivation facility; an outdoor and greenhouse cultivation site; and a state-of-the-art R&D facility that is currently under construction. From this campus, we produce recreational and medicinal products. Internationally, we intend to service the global medical cannabis market through our subsidiary Holigen, which has a license for cannabis cultivation in Portugal and will operate GMP-designed manufacturing facilities in Portugal and Australia.

Our purpose is to Cultivate Better: People, Plants, Products. To this end, we aim to support improving outcomes through responsible cannabis use and, as established experts in cannabis cultivation, strive to be the brand of choice for consumers and patients seeking the highest-quality craftsmanship and product consistency across a portfolio of differentiated cannabis products. All of this can only be achieved through the hard work of our growing, passionate team, who share the core values of being Pioneers, Champions, and Students, in all that we do. Visit www.flowr.ca for more information. 

POSITION SUMMARY

Flowr is seeking an experienced Payroll and Benefits Specialist who will be responsible for the payroll function, benefits administration and other total compensation related functions for the organization across Canada. Reporting into our Director, People and Culture, the Payroll Specialist will partner closely with our controller, as well as our People and Culture team in order to ensure that all pay and benefits related matters are executed on time, in the most efficient and cost effective manner possible. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated the ability to lead the development of the payroll strategy with key internal and external stakeholders to ensure optimal efficiency and effectiveness. This role will be based in Kelowna, BC. 

CORE JOB DUTIES

• Manage full-cycle payroll processing for 250-350 employees for a multi-province Canadian payroll (Hourly and Salaried) to ensure employees are paid accurately and timely.
• Under direction from the People team, assist in creating and maintaining Flowr’s compensation framework, including a job evaluation system with appropriate levels, salary bands, pay equity and total rewards details.
• Oversee and administer the benefits process, including benefits open enrollment, onboarding and related activities and communications. 
• Provide timely response to inquiries from managers, employees, government agencies and other third-party agencies.
• Be responsible for ensuring all internal audit processes and procedures are in place to support payroll and data integrity. 
• Ensure consistency of practices and compliance with strategy, policies, standards and regulatory requirements.
• Lead, organize, and be the point of contact for the implementation project of Flowr’s HR/payroll system - Ceridian Dayforce. Identify best practice opportunities, process gaps and system-enablement improvements. 
• Effectively utilize project management skills and cross-functional collaboration to lead projects and provide recommendations and reports to the People and Culture team and senior leadership as required.
• Support the People and Culture team in headcount management.
• Participate in various compensation surveys; providing appropriate compensation and wage information; stay current with industry trends and best practice through market research. 
• Other reasonable duties as may be required from time to time as directed by People and Culture team and the Finance team. 

JOB SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS 

• Payroll Compliance Certification (PCP) is required 
• Five or more years of progressive payroll experience in a multi-province payroll environment (particularly experience with Ontario and British Columbia) 
• In-depth knowledge of Canadian payroll legislation, Employment Standards, Taxation rules and year-end reporting processes, experience in British Columbia and Ontario payroll legislative requirements is essential.
• Previous system conversion experience or other experience in leading significant payroll process changes is an asset. In-depth knowledge of Ceridian Dayforce preferred. 
• Strong attention to detail and proven ability to take initiative, make independent decisions, exercise sound judgment, develop creative solutions and meet deadlines.
• Ability to maintain composure and handle multiple conflicting priorities in a fast-paced environment.
• Excellent verbal and outstanding written communication skills, including excellent presentation, facilitation, influence, and listening skills, with strong expertise in communicating scientific information.
• An individual with high integrity, creativity, and a roll-up your sleeves work ethic.

THE OPPORTUNITY 

This is an exciting opportunity to join a promising industry with lots of room for career growth and advancement. Work alongside a skilled, professional and passionate team that genuinely intends to make a mark in this rapidly growing industry. This role has breadth offering the candidate great experience in a fast-paced environment.
